item.description: 아래 코드에서 사용된 step의 값은 그래프를 더 직관적으로 표현하기 위해 $t=0.5$까지로 조정되었다. import math import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # parameter a, b = 0, 0 M = 10 nu = 1 / 6 dt = 0.02 step = int(0.5 / dt) dx = 1 / M color = plt.cm.jet(np.linspace(0, 1, step)) # initial data v = [0] * (M + 1) for i in range(1, M): x = 0 + i * dx v[i] = math.

import math import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # parameter a, b = 0, 0 M = 10 nu = 1 dt = 0.004 step = int(0.9 / dt) dx = 1 / M color = plt.cm.jet(np.linspace(0, 1, step)) # initial data v = [0] * (M + 1) for i in range(M + 1): x = 0 + i * dx v[i] = math.cos(math.pi * x / 2) # evolution for _ in range(step): v_new = v[:] for i in range(1, M): v_new[i] = v[i] + (nu * (v[i + 1] - 2 * v[i] + v[i - 1]) / dx ** 2) * dt v_new[0] = v[0] + (nu * 2 * (v[1] - v[0]) / dx ** 2) * dt v = v_new[:] plt.

$M = 20, \Delta t = 0.001$ import math import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # parameter a, b = 0, 0 M = 20 nu = 1 dt = 0.001 step = int(0.9 / dt) dx = 1 / M color = plt.cm.jet(np.linspace(0, 1, step)) # initial data v = [0] * (M + 1) for i in range(M + 1): x = 0 + i * dx v[i] = math.
